TEXT:
The worst airport in the world.
Terrible signage. Rudest staff ever and immigration takes one hour.
Huge queues.
An absolute dump

One of the most messy experience in my life. Seems like everything manages on the go - they changed the gate, staff wasn't aware about flights and gates, said me go to a wrong gate, I wasted my time standing in a wrong line (and passing xray control in transit zone). Then staff for several minutes tried to check my passport and flight to understand that it's not my gate.

And the last straw - I came back here again and they ask for applying online arrival form. And if you haven't done it in advance you have to pay for a "rush mode" almost $100, I think it's fair to call it "scam". I'll try to avoid this airport in future, total disappointment
Baad behaviour of staff

Your airport is the worst I've ever been to, everyone there doesn't have a smile. You are rude it was my dream to come to Malaysia but just upon arrival at the airport. I will never set foot in your country again.
We ask for directions, we are quickly answered with a haughty air and we never understand the answer. Frankly, I advise you against it. The food in the airport is disgusting.

The airport in Klia is quite big and the place is also nice, but unfortunately the airport staff are not friendly and not very informative (perhaps they are deliberately juggling so they don't get asked too many questions x yes) and in my opinion there is a lack of manpower... Because if I want to ask the officer... It's very difficult
At that time, I came from Jakarta and transited at KLIA to another country. When I got out of the plane, I just followed the procession to a certain place and it turned out that at that time we happened to appear near the food court area, in this place there weren't too many food stalls open but there were quite a few. choice of food type
At that time we tried several places with a menu of fried noodles, Hainanese rice, briyani rice and fried chicken
Of all the restaurants above, the winner is fried noodles, the taste is delicious to the Indonesian tongue, kyuuu, even the prices are cheaper compared to other restaurants.
And the worst thing is fried chicken, the fried chicken packages here are sold not with rice but some kind of cake (?) But it turns out they sell rice too and regret buying rice, apart from being expensive it turns out it's not worth eating, because the rice is already dry (what kind of rice is this? rengginang, right?) And the chicken is also a little dry, so when we come here we always avoid Malaysian fried chicken because that's how it is deeeh
BTW (talking in a whisper) even the sellers are also rude, loohhh... They are not friendly...

Ok type airport but can improve over slow immigration counter & throwing away all good water makes no sense. Difficult for kids n old or sick people who have to wait another hour n half to get water on airplane. Atleast spare the kids!

No international dining outlets.
No smoking room. Have to go to other terminal in bus for smoking.

I don't want to go there again. The staff's response during the transfer was the worst. I was made fun of and treated poorly because I couldn't speak English. I showed him my smartphone, which had a translation app on it, but the moment he saw the Japanese words, he violently threw the smartphone away. It was the first time in my life that I had been treated so cruelly. Malaysia Airlines flight to Changi International Airport on August 15, 2024 at 07:50. A Muslim woman wearing glasses. It was a really terrible response. I'll say it again. I don't want to go there again.

One of the worst airports in the world. Least tourist friendly in Southeast Asia. When it comes to transportation out of the airport, it‚Äôs simply a chaos. What‚Äôs the airport management thinking, designing the car park on Level 1, Door 5 that way. Go there at 7pm and it‚Äôs so chaotic, third world style traffic management. If you want to run an airport efficiently, send a delegation to your next door, which happens to run the best airport in the world.

Im pregnant so me and my family lined up at the pregnant/pwd section at the immigration. This woman told my husband and 2 little boys to go to regular line. So i end up going ahead of them and picking up all our bags. DOES NOT MAKE SENSE TO ME! Pure stupidity! But the couple next to me (who are white by the way) were allowed to line up at Pregnant/PWD line. Unfair!!!!
You have to be there at least 4 hours it is a huge airport and you take bus inside it to reach your gate
When do the KLIA management want to ban personal electrified vehicle in the public walkway? This really a threat to public safety, especially the youngs and the elders.

Fly at 15.05, depart at 11.30 from KL.
-Arrived later than borading.
- Poor plan, walking far and making you feel like you walked very far.
-Check the weight and number of every bag in great detail. For time
-Check inside the airport 2 times.
-Give it time, everything is not systematic. People at the airport were not as helpful as they should have been.
- Items that you are not in the mood to buy.

My experience at Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA) was extremely frustrating and stressful. The layout of the airport is confusing, and this leads to unnecessary stress and a lot of wasted time. Be prepared for an unreasonable amount of walking‚Äîyou might even need to take multiple buses and trains just to get where you need to go.

The staff are untrained and unprofessional. The food selection is poor, and on top of that, the service is both bad and incredibly slow. I had to follow up several times just to get my order. The toilets are dirty, and it's not uncommon for there to be no toilet paper.

Avoid KL and choose Singapore whenever possible

The connection between Terminal 1 and Terminal 2 is not well-marked, and worse, it isn‚Äôt even free. If you're traveling across the Asia-Pacific region and have the option to go through Singapore, do it. I decided to try KL because I liked the AirAsia business class option, which I admit is great, but the entire experience was ruined by the chaos of KLIA. If you want a better experience, go for ScootPlus. It may not be quite as luxurious as AirAsia business class, but it‚Äôs almost as good, and the experience is far better overall thanks to Singapore Changi International Airport.

Small tray for domestic flights during x ray , also coming from europe to domestic, i didn't know we need to take out our phones out , in europe the machine scans everything,  also toilets in klia are not clean . Main airport for the country but lacks so many basic infrastructure,  why do we need to take the bus from international terminal to the main one ? What if someone misses their flight ? A small airport in the middle of the mountains of europe is far superior than whatever abomination this is

Worst experience ever.. not even one officers are helpful or nice at all.. they treat people like we're not paying enough to get treated good .. also the airline (a.k.a Air Asia) is late, passengers are not informed when will the plane ready to boarding, the waiting room is so small and full with people standing waiting for the late airline.. overall is very not professional and not enjoyable experience.. need more improvements
Batik air OD527 flight delayed 1hours, then baggage claim delayed 1hours, inefficient management
The airport does not have a smoking room and there are employees for you

Baggage or suitcases not locked or without padlocks will be opened & things stolen.
Even chargers & powerbank got stolen after taking a flight from KLIA to Denpasar, Bali Airport.
Dishonest staffs working at KLIA. What a shame when thieves working for KLIA Airport. Regret for putting my trust at the people working for the Airport.

Immigration: Rude
Baggage claim: Across terminal
Baggage condition: Destroyed
Baggage drop: Even slower and scrambled across counters
Signage: Unclear
AC: Not even a proper room temperature

Everything is not proper and really really slow like they don't value time, idk.

one of the good airports, clean, comfortable and complete facilities. There is a free shuttle bus to other terminals. The only drawback is that IMMIGRATION is very SLOW and not nice. My personal experience was being yelled at by an IMMIGRATION OFFICER named Saif*l at the PRIORITY counter even though I was PREGNANT. Need to be taught MANNERS and a sense of EMPATHY and AWARENESS that they are not everything there.

The most international airlines will dock at the satellite terminal. Hence, it needs to take shuttle after check-in. The security will be checked at the gate, so that you're not able to bring any drinks aboard.

Very unfriendly airport. Absolutely no comments. The staff don't speak English and not even a bit interested in helping passengers. So much miscommunication and confusion. The restaurant staff there gave Nasi Lemak saying it's vegan, only to find out there was fish mixed with the recipe. Had to throw the whole package away. Money wasted. Malaysians are always upset over something and very divided within themselves. Discrimination at peak.
I would take all means to avoid your airport again.
Onaardig, brutaal personeel die het totaal niet nodig vinden je op enkele wijze te helpen of √ºberhaupt te woord te staan. Ik zou dit land en dit vliegveld overslaan!
lousy serviced staffs and lousy system.

I am complaining, but I am wondering and expecting the explanation.
1. At gate H2 today around 16.00. Those persons who are in charge, confiscate my
1. drinking water, which I need for taking my tablet.
2. Shampoo, soap and lotion

said it is regulation.
Said the airline prohibited anything over 150 ML carry inside cabin.Told them, I never had problem before. Never used luggage.

But, when I took video, they were panic and insisting me to delete it. Especially since I answered them I will file a complain.
Why they have to panic?
CCTV can proofed it
Funny thing, this one lady, yelling to me asking for my boarding pass and passport, took picture of those.

I mention, my last trip to KL.was okay, she said all malaysian airline are not allowing.
And right before I left, she was making sure if I am not filling a complain again 'just doing what they had to' .

So, is this mean, airline prohibited and still selling the water during the flight?
Or, the airport prohibited?

There was also another passenger who carried used perfume with very small amout left in 250 ML bottle. Also took away... so is this about the size or the amount?

Thank you.

StarLux Airlines enters and exits at the Satellite Terminal of Terminal 1. You need to take a shuttle bus to the main terminal. Entry and exit are in the same building on different floors. There are no signs and it is like a maze. Fortunately, we were guided by a Chinese-speaking girl before we walked out.
This trip is to Cherating Bay. There are no souvenirs sold in the village, so you can only buy them at the airport. The snacks and souvenirs after immigration are cheaper than before.
Worst experience so far, super crowded, there was no sign to suggest passengers to fill in card for immigration. The line was horrendous.

Der schlimmste Flughafen, den ich je erlebt habe, der Null Sterne verdient hat!!! Total un√ºbersichtlich, unorganisiert, krass unfreundliches Personal, jeder schickt einen woanders hin. Ich musste wg Gewicht mein Handgep√§ck nachzahlen. Viel zu lange Wege, versp√§tete Abflugszeiten. Ich war nur auf der Durchreise und war wg der langen Wege, falschen Informationen vom Personal& der Un√ºbersichtlichkeit 10Min zu sp√§t beim Boarding und wurde nicht mehr ins Flugzeug gelassen, obwohl dieses dann noch √ºber 30Min am Gate stand.

No drinking Water Facility by Airport Authority. Travellers have to buy and drink, and in Checking : not even small amounts of water are not allowed , Security Staff  forced everyone to throw water/ bottle in Garbage.  Airport staff are a little Rude not Traveller Friendly.

The airport design are pleasant to see. But i had mixed experience at this airport. Some staff are friendly, some are rude & can be tricky. It's good to follow rules, but it's not good to be rude/tricky. By saying rude i mean being disrespectful. Would be better if customer experience can be raised to both professional & hospitable.
The lounge is good food is bad
Totally chaotic and disorganized airport. Hardly any toilets in the arrival area (baggage claim) and long queues even in the men's toilet.

I don't want to go there again. The staff's response during the transfer was the worst. I was made fun of and treated poorly because I couldn't speak English. I showed him my smartphone, which had a translation app on it, but the moment he saw the Japanese words, he violently threw the smartphone away. From beginning to end, he had a displeased expression and tone. It was the first time in my life that I had been treated so cruelly. Malaysia Airlines departing from Changi International Airport on August 15, 2024 at 7:50. A female employee who is Muslim and wears glasses. It was a really terrible response. I'll say it again. I definitely don't want to go there again. I will definitely not include Malaysia as a travel destination in the future.

Worst Passenger Focus
No sufficient Car/Buggie Services
Long Waiting time for immigration
It is quite unpleasant to be at an airport with cockroaches around the seating area of the gate.
The security are so rude
Terribly inefficient. Bus to get to immigration. Long queues. Then pointless bag scan on airport exit. Grab stand badly signposted. Take a trip to Changi and learn from the best

Huge airport where they doesn‚Äôt handle your baggage well. Or they just stole if they like. Who knows? We traveled from KLIA to Budapest, via Istanbul and had 2 checked baggages. 1 arrived, 1 lost. Nobody knows what happened. According to the international baggage tracking system, the baggage is still in KLIA and they don‚Äôt do anything about it. Budapest asked them twice to send it, but nothing happened. You can‚Äôt even call them, because there is wrong telephone number on the website. Worst airport, and worst baggage handling ever. Band of thieves.
There is no pharmacy or first aid station in the departure area!
No air conditioning...we feel like in terminal bus...system slow

The the worst international airport I've been too. Extremely hot, bad queuing system causing blockages of people trying to walk past. Not enough people on gates to let people through.

Needs reorganising

Bad airport management! We were rudelly told to leave by the staff on the waiting area gate Q13 with no clear reason even though it was our departing gate than 20 minutes later they told us to get back in.
This happened at 6th October 2024 at Q13 gate while waiting for flight QZ327
no aircon

Automatic immigration screening is very easy!
Please never bring cigarettes
Of course, I brought it with me thinking it would be enough.
They also took an X-ray upon entry.
I bought it in Vietnam and brought it back, but got caught and had to pay taxü§£ (about 30,000 won)
I wasn't trying to hide it, I didn't know.
Customs are lying thieves. Malaysian Airlines and other sources state the cigarettes duty free allowance is 200 cigarettes, but I was charged duty of MYR132

Worst Passenger Focus
No sufficient Car/Buggie Services
Long Waiting time for immigration
No sufficient provision of drinking water
Very bad hospitality..phone no given cannot get for almost one hour...text ask question no reply at all...wat kind of service providing to people

They asked for a visa even though I had a visa exemption. Airasia They are all ignorant, rude and disrespectful. Then the ticket was again disrespectful and hostile. There are stamps from many countries in my passport, yet they examined it with a microscope. Zero knowledge, zero respect. I understand that anything can happen to you in Malaysia. I will demand an account of this on all international platforms.

Massive airport, have to walk like 2 kilometres to get to the e-hailing gate, booking a car and finding it in the crowd and loading the luggages can be demanding‚Ä¶ Car rentals all closed when I arrived at 11 pm‚Ä¶

Departure terminal for airasia, despite being very strict with the luggage allowance, only has 1 luggage weighing station. Crowded there.

Have to go through the security twice, one after the customs, one before the departure gates‚Ä¶ not sure why ‚Ä¶

Definitely needs some process improvement..

Never ever Use this Malaysia airline for our travel... We regret for that sure.......

I am writing to formally express my dissatisfaction with the customer service I received at the check-in counter during my recent flight with Malaysia airlines on MH0109 from COK to MEL on 15th October 2024.

Upon arrival at the check-in counter, I experienced significant delays due to the disorganized and overwhelmed staff. Despite arriving well in advance, I had to wait for an extended period, which caused unnecessary stress and inconvenience.

During check-in, my personal electronic devices (laptop and tablet) were included in the calculation of my baggage weight, resulting in additional charges. Unfortunately, my main baggage had already been processed, leaving me no opportunity to adjust its contents.

Despite having only 1 kg of excess weight, I was forced to dispose of some personal items to comply with the weight limit. I find it unfair and unjustified that personal electronic devices, typically considered essential carry-on items, were treated as checked baggage.

Furthermore, while at the payment counter, a senior staff member, who appeared to be a supervisor, inquired about the sales target for the day by asking "How much is the sale amount". This interaction left me with the impression that the airline's policy is to reduce the airfare and then force passengers to pay for petty baggage differences at the airport. This practice is both misleading and exploitative.

The manner in which this situation was handled by your staff was unprofessional and lacked empathy. Despite my attempts to explain the situation, I was met with indifference and a lack of willingness to assist. This experience has left me deeply dissatisfied with the level of service provided by Malaysia airlines.

I have traveled a lot and been to many airports, but like the wait that happened to me at Malaysian passports, waiting for more than two hours at the passport control has become something abnormal, and there are only three employees stamping for a huge number of passengers. Unfortunately, they delayed our flight time by about half an hour. Thank God, the airline waited for its late passengers for some reasons. Beyond their control and circumstances.

Worst airport I've ever experienced that deserves zero stars!!! Totally confusing, disorganized, extremely unfriendly staff, everyone sends you somewhere else. I had to pay extra for my hand luggage because of the weight. Way too long, delayed departure times. I was just passing through and was 10 minutes late boarding due to the long distances, incorrect information from the staff and the confusion and was not allowed on the plane, even though it was still at the gate for over 30 minutes.
Wait to pass Immigration

It does not matter how new and nice the airport is. Or how well trained the staff is.
Because the security at pre gates do not allow or provide for any WATER.
CAN YOU GET ANY STUPIDER
How can older people and kids go for hours without.  How can people take their medicine at a particular time with no water.
Very very stupid
Going to the airport feels like going to the mall
Nice airport but service may be improved especially for shuttle.......

It was a beautiful place. When I returned home, there was a light baggage check, so I stopped by a shop and bought some water, but the water was confiscated immediately after the pre-boarding check. It was my first time in Malaysia in 10 years, so it's my fault for forgetting about it (lol).It's the kind of airport where you can enjoy the good feeling of Malaysia until you return home.
This is the first time I've seen immigration officers openly give negotiable baggage prices. KL X Malaysian water batik.

The airport design are pleasant to see. Clean as well. But i had mixed experience at this airport. Some staff are friendly, some are rude & can be tricky. It's good to follow rules, but it's not good to be rude/tricky. By saying rude i mean being disrespectful. Would be better if customer experience can be raised to both professional & hospitable.
I like the vibes in the airport with a metro connectivity inside the airport. One of the busiest airport.

Good comfortable airport with plenty of cafes and eateries that accept international cards. Comfortable seats so I could sleep while waiting on my long layover. It's very clean to the point the floors are shinning and the toilets are regularly clean. The free WiFi is good so I could keep in touch with my family and watch some YouTube to pass the time. The experience of my layover here was a very good one.
Nice & clean place
Cool, comfortable

Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KUL) is modern and spacious, with two main terminals (KLIA1 and KLIA2). It offers duty-free shopping, diverse dining, transit hotels, and easy access via the KLIA Ekspres train. Traveling between the two terminals takes about 10 minutes.
Always clean and tidy

I recently traveled through Kuala Lumpur International Airport, and I was thoroughly impressed by my experience. The infrastructure is modern and well-maintained, making navigation seamless. The signs are clear, and the layout is intuitive, ensuring that travelers can easily find their way around. Lots of dining options. There are charging stations in front of the gates. Also multiple lounges are available at both the terminals.

One of the standout features was the efficiency of the immigration process. I was pleasantly surprised at how quickly I moved through immigration. Actually there are multiple counters which helps to avoid long queues in any one counter.

What truly made my visit memorable, however, was the friendliness of the staff. From the check-in counters to the security personnel, everyone I encountered was welcoming and eager to assist whenever I needed some help.
Big airport check in place in one place for KLIA 1
Nice and big airport. Not much eating and shopping though but still okay enough for you to walk around and explore, especially if you are waiting for transit or your flight.

Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA), also known as Lapangan Terbang Antarabangsa Kuala Lumpur, offers an outstanding experience for travelers. The airport is modern, spacious, and well-organized, making navigation easy even for first-time visitors. Its layout allows for smooth transitions between international and domestic flights, and the signage is clear and helpful in multiple languages.

KLIA is equipped with excellent facilities, including a wide variety of dining options, from local Malaysian cuisine to international favorites. The shopping experience is fantastic, offering duty-free stores with an impressive range of luxury goods, souvenirs, and essentials. The airport also provides comfortable lounges for relaxation, as well as clean and spacious rest areas for those in transit.

The efficiency of security checks and baggage handling is commendable, ensuring a quick and hassle-free experience. Transportation options are also abundant, with easy access to trains, buses, and taxis, allowing for seamless travel to and from the city center.

Overall, Kuala Lumpur International Airport stands out for its cleanliness, efficiency, and hospitality, making it one of the top airports in the region. It offers a stress-free and enjoyable start or end to any journey.

A huge airport with 2 terminals. Take care it is far from the city and with use of the public transportation,  you may need 75 to 90 minutes to arrive. The departure process is smooth and fast. There are a lot of restaurants, shops and lounges. C gate needs a special shuttle from terminal 1. There is a special terminal for domestic flights.
It's a big, clean green building with clear directions for movement. There are many food shops and Din Tai Fung is standing there, so there are a lot of people dining there.

It's a bit far from the city, but easily accessible by airport rail and highway. The internal guidelines are also very clear and clear, there are many businesses, and there are many delicious foods to choose from. The airport exit customs is also very efficient. However, the internal facilities are somewhat outdated and cannot be used normally, but overall it is a very good airport.
The Airport was very big and clean

TBH I miss Kuala Lumpur so much - four days felt like four seconds bruh I ain't getting enough from the travel. Look at all these cute stuff I saw in KLIA! They had lots of stuffed animals here. By the way Jaya Grocer was aesthetic especially the cold beverage area, they had my favourite drinks as well I'm definitely going again I wish!
Good

Cool. But would prefer that they stock up on whats needed thats available at other stores ngl

Airport is windy
Airport is massive so takes time to get from one side to other side, staff are happy to help to passengers out but still a bit tricky.
It's also fun to have a long transit here
Great facilities and good staffs. Nice architecture and easy navigation.
They take good care of the suitcases and it is quite quick to leave the airport. Additionally, for international flights from Europe they have self-passport registration.
Amazing experience.clean and spacious with lots of food and beverages optionüòú

What I love about KLIA is that it's attached to a shopping mall, so when you have a long layover like me, you can exit the airport and do some window shopping for a bit. The food court was pretty good as well, it was still pretty expensive to buy food at the airport but the variety was awesome!

There were plenty of charging areas, I spent a night sleeping at the carpeted floor along with other travelers, so KLIA do a terrific job compare to other airports especially on the ASEAN. (Changi is excluded for a obvious reason)

KLIA is pretty huge and long, so expect a long walk from the check in to your gate.
The airport is spacious and clean. The immigration process also runs quickly.
Clean and spacious airport with modern facilities. Only an hour by car from KL city centre.
Large international airport, automatic baggage check-in counters, no long waiting times, and a shopping center with a variety of items
Entry and exit are very fast, Taiwan passport can automatically clear customs
Clean and spacious airport with modern facilities. Only 1 hour by car from KL city center.

Urban and luxury.. really convenient.. staff are so helpful and friendly. Keep it up the good work everyone!

Such an unforgettable experience! Will visit again for sure!

KL International Airport is the main airport serving the city of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. It consists of two terminals, KLIA and KLIA 2. The airport premises were well maintained and kept clean throughout my journey. Although it's slightly distant from the city centre, it has great connectivity with taxis and the KLIA express train. Overall, I had a good experience with the airport.

Kuala Lumpur International Airport, the gateway to Kuala Lumpur!!
I get excited the moment I get off the train.
quickly
The airport is huge (spacious) and the all of the staff members are friendly. They have done a speedy service on my departure documentation process
The airport is nice and clean. The food is reasonably priced and not cut-throat like Vietnamese style
Great airport, full of tenant

"This airport is one of the best I‚Äôve visited. It‚Äôs modern, clean, and very well-maintained. The facilities are excellent, and there are plenty of places to eat and shop. The free Wi-Fi is fast, and there are plenty of comfortable seating areas. It feels like a place you could relax while waiting for your flight. Highly recommend flying through here!"
Was surprised greeted with this traditional malay instrumental songs complete with those old instruments when walking out from bus from international arrival flights. Seriously 5 ‚≠ê services klia
Smooth access to departure area. Also got wrapping service. But pick up at arrivals hall always jam due to inconsiderate drivers parking.

Nice Airport we have been there only for transit and there is few seating space on outside waiting area which cannot cater all people for sit i think. and duty free shops also there we can buy what we need. and we saw some green area but we having enough time to visit there it could be some artificial forest

I took AirAsia and AirAsia 2. The airport is very big. I arrived at around 7 o'clock in the morning, 25 minutes earlier than the scheduled time. After filling in the immigration information, just like Taiwan, I used a machine to scan and go through customs automatically. It was very convenient and fast.
Great Airport with much to do, boardwalk, and other activities. Showcases Malaysian Culture and Hospitality

Great Facilities and services,
friendly staff
Very well organized.  Pleasant staff. Fast and clean.
